intro: Takhtajaniantha tau-saghyz, commonly known as the Armenian or Caucasian watercress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many edible and economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its upright stems, alternate leaves, and small white or yellow flowers. Its leaves are often used in traditional cuisine, particularly in Armenian and Georgian dishes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in stream banks and mountainous habitats.
